abstract: Eduardo Porter Economic Scene column notes that data released by Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development suggest aging populations of world's advanced industrial nations has led to reduction in gross replacement rates of public pension systems, finding that dovetails with Social Security Administration report issued in 2014; warns trends indicate that many future retirees will not have sufficient income from pensions to avoid poverty.
lead_paragraph: If Social Security’s shrinking trust funds aren’t replenished, pensions of the future may not be enough to live on.

headline.main: An Aging Society Changes the Story on Poverty for Retirees
headline.print_headline: Aging Society Changes Story on Poverty in Old Age

snippet: If Social Security’s shrinking trust funds aren’t replenished, pensions of the future may not be enough to live on.

keywords.value: Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development
keywords.name: organizations
